description: From Ancient Greek stem of φρέαρ (phréar, “well, spring”).

adjectives.description: phreatic (comparative more phreatic, superlative most phreatic)

entries.meaning: (geology) Of or pertaining to ground water; (volcanology) involving explosively rapid heating of ground water by magma.
examples:
Both

 and q vary from point to point within a phreatic aquifer.
